text: Terebra fijiensis is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Terebridae, the auger snails. ==Description== The length of the shell varies between 20 mm and 45 mm. ==Distribution== This marine species occurs off the Philippines and the Fiji Islands. ==References== * Bratcher T. & Cernohorsky W.O. (1987). Living terebras of the world. A monograph of the recent Terebridae of the world. American Malacologists, Melbourne, Florida & Burlington, Massachusetts. 240pp * Terryn Y. (2007). Terebridae: A Collectors Guide. Conchbooks & NaturalArt. 59pp + plates. ==External links== * Gastropods.com: Terebra (Textilis-group) fijiensis Category:Terebridae Category:Gastropods described in 1873
title: Terebra fijiensis
